frontmatter.title: October Update
frontmatter.description: As chill winds descend from the north and leaves turn to yellow and red, fall, and crunch underfoot, I wish we could huddle together, sharing hot drinks and thoughts, and feeling comfort in one another’s' presence. Instead, we congregate over Zoom calls and emails, seeking connectedness in the harsh cold glares of our computer screens. So I'm emailing you again; to tell you about my last few months; to try to keep the interpersonal connections that I have; to try and grow the connections that I don't have; and to connect with you in whatever way is available to me.

node.excerpt: by Albert Carter and Alex Crompton. Update, November 4, 2020: a BikePoints website is now live. Update, October 15, 2020: The City of Cambridge, MA is showing some interest in this, since it fits well into the Cambridge 2020 Bicycle Plan. frontmatter.title: A Dutch Import We Can All Love: Bike Points
frontmatter.description: They're cheap, politically easy, and improve people's lives. Find out what they are, how to make them, and how to bring them to the US.
